display_name.description: Display name of the generator, if not provided, the name will be used

targets.description:
Target directories to place the generated files
Target directories to add the file(s) to. If it does not exist, it will be created.

vars.description:
Variables to use in the generator, these are evaluated after the prompts

The variables are available in the templates as `{{ vars.var_name }}`

Available context variables:
- `prompts`: The values of the prompts

oneOf.description: Add a single file specified by a template file

base_path.description:
If provided, it will be stripped from the file names of the template files.
If absent, use the generator's directory as the base path.

error_message.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a failure message.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.
- `error`: A string containing the error message that was returned by the action.

file.description: Provide a single template file to add, does not support glob patterns.

flatten.description: Disregard the folder structure of the template files and flatten them into write them into a single directory.

if.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to boolean that determines if the action should be executed.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

in_progress_message.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a progress message.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

name.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a name for the action.
Should be unique within the same action group.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

overwrite.description: How to handle overwriting existing files.

success_message.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a success message.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

oneOf.description: Add a single file specified by an inline template in the configuration

content.description: Accepts an inline tera template that will be evaluated to a string that will be used to produce the file.

error_message.description:
Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a failure message.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.
- `error`: A string containing the error message that was returned by the action.

output_path.description: The path of the file to write to. Will be resolved relative to the output directory.

overwrite.description: How to handle overwriting existing files.

Accepts a tera template that should evaluate to a string that will be used as a success message.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

supports_dry_run.description:
By default, running this type of action is not supported in dry run mode.
If set to true, this action will be run even in dry run mode.

target.description: Will be used as the working directory for the action execution.

separator.description: Whether to use this option as a separator.

oneOf.description: Prompt the user to confirm overwriting existing files.

default.description:
The default value of the checkbox.
Accepts a tera expression that will be evaluated to a boolean that will be used as the default value.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

remember.description:
Whether to remember the value of this prompt to the session so that future invocations of the generator don't ask the user again
when used in the same directory.

default.description:
The default value of the select.
Accepts a tera expression that will be evaluated to a string that will be used as the default value.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

options.description: The available options for the select.

remember.description:
Whether to remember the value of this prompt to the session so that future invocations of the generator don't ask the user again
when used in the same directory.

default.description:
The default value of the multi-select.
Accepts a list of tera expressions that will be evaluated to a list of strings that will be used as the default value.

Available Context
- `prompts`: A dictionary containing the values of the prompts that were asked previously.
- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

options.description: The available options for the multi-select.

remember.description:
Whether to remember the value of this prompt to the session so that future invocations of the generator don't ask the user again
when used in the same directory.

validate.description: The validation rules for the prompt.

default.description:
Accepts a tera expression that will be evaluated to a float that will be used as the default value.

- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

remember.description:

validate.description: The validation rules for the prompt.

default.description:

- `env`: A dictionary containing the environment variables available for the output directory.

remember.description:
Whether to remember the value of this prompt to the session so that future invocations of the generator don't ask the user again
when used in the same directory.

validate.description: The validation rules for the prompt.

condition.description:
Accepts a tera expression that will be evaluated to a boolean that determines if the prompt is valid.

Available Context
- `value`: The value of the prompt.

error_message.description:
Accepts a tera expression that will be evaluated to a string that will be used as an error message if the prompt is invalid.

Available Context
- `value`: The value of the prompt.
